data.title: Dissidia Final Fantasy NT Guide
data.meta_description: There are plenty of unlockables in Dissidia Final Fantasy NT that can be obtained a few different ways.  By playing matches in every game mode, you can
data.text:
There are plenty of unlockables in Dissidia Final Fantasy NT that can be obtained a few different ways. By playing matches in every game mode, you can increase your Player Level to gain Treasures and Gil. Both of these allow you to either receive random unlockables, as well as purchase specific ones from the game's Shop in the main menu.

Related Trophies

Loading

Play

Treasure Hunter

Claimed treasure 100 times

They're free! What an Offer!

Claimed treasure 300 times

Treasures are obtained each time you level up your Player Level or complete a trial in Gauntlet Mode. Treasures are groups of random unlockables that you can open up in the Treasures menu from the main menu. When you receive treasures, you will gain a boost in Gil if you obtain duplicates, with the only exception being player icons that change the effects when you obtain a duplicate.

Gil is the money from the Final Fantasy universe that you can spend in the Shop menu. Every item in the shop can be randomly gained by opening up Treasures you obtain after battles, you can purchase a specific unlockable you want using Gil.

You receive Gil when participating or winning any match from any game mode, including story battles. Gil can also be obtained when receiving duplicate unlockables when you open up your treasures.

Character Items

Player Profile Icons

Extra Battle Music Tracks

List of Dissidia Final Fantasy NT Unlockables

Here is a list of every unlockable item that can be obtained in Dissidia Final Fantasy NT, all of which can be found and purchased in the Shop.

Character Items

Character items are costumes, weapons, and chat messages you can unlock for specific characters. Each character costume costs about 10800 Gil, Weapons cost 7200 Gil, and alternate Chat Messages cost about 3600 Gill respectively.

Player Icons

Player icons are images that display with your player info. These are shown online before a battle battle and in custom lobbies, as well as when you play offline. Player icons can be purchased three times to display three stars, with each successive purchase changing the effect of the icon when its displayed.

Player icons can gain sparkle effects, flashes, and/or color gradients when you purchase them multiple times or obtain them from opening treasures. The icons you can choose from are based on characters from multiple Final Fantasy games, including characters that aren't playable in Dissidia Final Fantasy NT, but may be important to various games in the Final Fantasy series.

Listed below are the different character icons you can obtain (duplicates excluded) in relation to each title of the series. Some characters appear multiple times in different styles.

Battle Music Tracks

Battle tracks are background music that you can select for your custom playlist. these can be set in your Customization menu, which will allow you to enable to disable any music track in the game. By setting up a custom playlist, you can have your own mix of music that plays during the battles in every game mode.

Additional music tracks can be obtained from treasures or purchased in the shop. These are tracks that are iconic and popular pieces of music from every Final Fantasy title featured in the game, including a few extra bonus tracks.
